Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Minor
b) Defect Observed: Pneumatic starter motor overheat. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Thermal cycling induced solder joint failure in electronic assembly
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pneumatic Starter component. Analysis
of operational data indicated parameter deviation.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct detailed inspection of all similar components in fleet
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Issue technical bulletin to all operators
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 27/05/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. A.K. Sharma
